I have loved the PokÃ©mon universe for as long as I can remember  and just like everyone else  when PokÃ©mon go hit the App Store I was enthralled. However  after about 3 weeks me and my wife hit â€œthe wall.â€   It was to grindy with not enough rewards or player interaction. So we left for 2 years.  Someone at work inspired me to download it again so me and my wife activated our old accounts and gave it a shot. We noticed a HUGE difference! Different game all together. So to sum up the major differences I have put together a small list to help you jump right in:  1. There are PokÃ©mon literally EVERYWHERE! There is nearly 5 times more PokÃ©mon to catch than when the game first launched. It allows me to play from home a lot more. I find myself logging in and catching PokÃ©mon right on my bedroom when Iâ€™m not even planning on going outside. Terrific! There is also a much larger PokÃ©mon pool to catch.  2. Friend system  daily gifts  trading system  training system  battle system  raids  daily quests  special quests  quest earned mythical encounters  and adventure sync (ability to accumulate steps while not playing). All of these systems have expanded the game into something better. It will be the reason we play for years and years.  3. The variety of special PokÃ©mon! PokÃ©mon in holiday hats  ultra rare shines PokÃ©mon  abnormal element typed PokÃ©mon. I hatched a Sandshrew that is steel/ice type. He looks a lot different and learns different attacks. Super cool! It adds a sense of uniqueness between one player and another and makes trading PokÃ©mon a lot more desirable.   Thank you for launching all the of the essential updates. We really enjoy playing PokÃ©mon Go!
column5: 3 Reasons Pokemon Go won back my alligence

The game is great majority of the time. When itâ€™s not its logs out randomly  makes you walk in a different direction and the spoofers.   I personally like the game compared to other games out there. Donâ€™t know if itâ€™s because Iâ€™m an original PokÃ©mon fan from the 90â€™s or people just bandwagon from game to game (like Fortnite  Minecraft  Clash  Roblox and similar). I understand that the games have down times or might get boring for a month period but it doesnâ€™t mean that you should follow everyone to a particular game.   The reason I think the numbers of players are down slightly or some is due to the decrease of rare spawns. I personally like the game now because you have a variety of PokÃ©mon spawning. You have a few rare spawns with some good evolution spawns (great stardust) and the different generations spawning. The game before was like catch a Rare spawn then the next street over catch another rare spawn and then do for awhile.   A few features that are needed or could be improved is:  1) limiting or completely removing the spoofers. By limiting the spoofers it means removing gyms from their games  no friends feature and limit of 30 PokÃ©mon caught a day.  2) Offer discounts or promotions at different places that are PokÃ©stops or gyms. Most times people just spin a PokÃ©stop and keep going or do a battle/raid at a gym then leave.  3) Have the nearby feature but add the â€œwildâ€ feature if you are in a busy PokÃ©stop area.  4) Have raids happen at night too. Some work during the day or some people are night people and might want to get out at that time. 5) With the big events (such as Safari Zone) is have a change of place each year. I know that the Community Days are great fillers but the issue is that people canâ€™t always take time off to go to Chicago or Japan or wherever.  6) Weather Boosted PokÃ©mon categories should be equal. Most times to all the time the weather boost caters to 1 maybe 2 types of PokÃ©mon.

However I was extremely disappointed to find out that you have to scan other trainers. Thereâ€™s absolutely no way Iâ€™m going to go ask strangers at a coffee shop if they play pokÃ©mon and want to battle.  I had hoped other trainers ready for battle would show up in the nearby section  kind of sending out a beacon to other trainers saying â€œhey Iâ€™m here too and wanna battleâ€. Thereâ€™s just no way I can actually battle with other trainers without having to find leagues and find others who are willing to battle at their convenience instead of just finding random players in my area already ready to go. I donâ€™t think enough thought about the average player who doesnâ€™t run in pokemongo crowds was put into this. Itâ€™s like the game forces you to find other players on your own who can battle at the same times you want to

The App Store page for this app does not disclose that the publisher blocks access to many of the most popular features to accounts registered to children under age 13. Such popular features include: - Pokemon trading - Friendships with other players (Trainers)  and related in-game benefits (Lucky Pokemon  7-km eggs featuring special PokÃ©mon  gift exchanges with friends  etc.) - New Trainer Battles (no player vs. player when you canâ€™t make friends in-app...) - Sponsored Poke Gyms (often home to special activities such as EX Raids)  The publisher offers no way for parents to opt-in to these features on behalf of their children (or themselves  when using their kidsâ€™ accounts).    Niantic Kids was announced over the summer as a way for parents to manage accounts. That feature is apparently only available to new registrants  isnâ€™t available to existing account holders  and doesnâ€™t include the opt-in feature that users are asking for.   Meanwhile  childrenâ€™s accounts can easily make in-app purchases without obtaining parental consent.   The unfortunate result is that children and their parents who truthfully disclose their actual dates of birth when opening their accounts are penalized  and the app creates an incentive for parents to encourage their kids to lie about their age.

Love this game! Been playing it since launch  and it gets better and better over time. This is game is simply  amazing without a doubt. However  I believe it can get even better! To improve upon this already great game  here are a few new features I believe many fans would appreciate being added to the game as an potential update sometime in the near future:  1. More choices for avatar customization - More hair styles and colors  - More skin tones - more facial features    a. character/trademark masks/costumes/etc.   b. more sizes/shapes/styles of noses  eyes  mouths  chin  ears  etc.   c. more body types     > heavy     > athletic      > skinny     > average      > other   d. ability to change your avatarâ€™s height     > The ability to change your avatarâ€™s battle team (maybe only once every 3 months or so) - Valor to Mystic/Instinct - Mystic to Valor/Instinct  - Instinct to Valor/Mystic 3. Ability to request/vote for the addition of new pokÃ©-stop and gym locations (most certainly in states/regions/cities/townships/rural areas where there really arenâ€™t many pokÃ©-stop locations or gyms within walking distance of local residents) 4. Allowing players to view areas very far away from their current location  - ability to scroll and zoom in/out to view pokÃ©-stops and gyms in other states  providences  cities  and countries around the world   a. when viewing gyms outside a 2 mile radius of your current location:     > allow players the ability to view the PokÃ©mon and their respective CP levels  current raid bosses/live timers  and the team who is currently in control of that gym     > allow players to send berries to to a damaged PokÃ©mon from far away (maybe only one or a maximum of one berry/per day is allowed to be sent to a trainerâ€™s PokÃ©mon from far away similar to how special trades are allowed only once per day) 5. Ability to skip dialogue during research tasks 6. Ability to skip animations such as evolution animations  hatching egg animations  leveling up animations  and trading animations  etc.  7. Ability to chat      > w/ friends     > w/ other players during raid battles      > with a code for a online chatroom 8. etc.   These are a few features Iâ€™d like to see being added to the game and I can confirm that Iâ€™m not really the only person who wants these features to be added. There are many fans out there who are probably in agreement with me that many of the aforementioned features should be added to the game to make it more enjoyable than it is now.   Just a few suggestions to consider. No big deal if they arenâ€™t added to the game  but it would be a bummer if they werenâ€™t because many of my friends have told me they would very much like these suggestions to be considered and added as soon as possible. Nevertheless  still a fantastic game and I will continue to play it regardless of whether or not any more changes are made to the game. Lastly  I thank you for your time  and have a great rest of your day/night! Gotta catch â€˜em all!

This game had a rocky start. It was super popular and the servers couldnâ€™t handle it. Now the developers push a new event almost all the time. Getting mew was fun and challenging(Ditto). Celebi and Spiritomb were arduous to obtain but Meltan has been extremely challenging because I donâ€™t have a Nintendo switch. They have also pulled off some very awesome community days once a month where you get a similar ambiance to when the game first came out. Tons of people playing! They also used one of them to introduce a new mythical PokÃ©mon in a very creative way.  I have enjoyed the new raid and research updates. We just need more ways to get silver pinaps.  Trading has been introduced to the game in a way that doesnâ€™t ruin it and trading rare PokÃ©mon with strangers is costly but with people you interact with daily itâ€™s cheap.  The game is mostly free to play but I have personally spent some money on it. There was an egg event and I wanted more incubators. Anyways I wasnâ€™t ever forced to buy anything and it isnâ€™t like other apps where they throw sales in your face as pop ups every time you log in. You can earn 50 in game coins per day without paying a dime but that can be drastically easier or harder based on where you live.  In the past year this game has drastically changed into something truly addictive and fun to play. I canâ€™t wait to see what they bring to the game next year.

This game had a rocky start. It was super popular and the servers couldnâ€™t handle it. Now the developers push a new event almost all the time. Getting mew was fun and challenging(Ditto). Celebi and Spiritomb were arduous to obtain but Meltan has been extremely challenging because I donâ€™t have a Nintendo switch. They have also pulled off some very awesome community days once a month where you get a similar ambiance to when the game first came out. Tons of people playing! They also used one of them to introduce a new mythical PokÃ©mon in a very creative way.  I have enjoyed the new raid and research updates. We just need more ways to get silver pinaps.  Trading has been introduced to the game in a way that doesnâ€™t ruin it and trading rare PokÃ©mon with strangers is costly but with people you interact with daily itâ€™s cheap.  The game is mostly free to play but I have personally spent some money on it. There was an egg event and I wanted more incubators. Anyways I wasnâ€™t ever forced to buy anything and it isnâ€™t like other apps where they throw sales in your face as pop ups every time you log in. You can earn 50 in game coins per day without paying a dime but that can be drastically easier or harder based on where you live.  In the past year this game has drastically changed into something truly addictive and fun to play. I canâ€™t wait to see what they bring to the game next year.

column2: All these reviews are very often problems with peopleâ€™s phones being old and they donâ€™t know how to fix it. I have hardly had any of these problems playing with an iPhone 6s. Also  for those that say they make you pay money and itâ€™s hard to get poke balls  very often they live in a backwoods area  I have never had much of a problem with this if I go out and spin poke stops for 20 minutes.  That being said  this is a wonderful game that has gotten me and my friends out of our houses and having a good time. Iâ€™ve loved all things PokÃ©mon since season 1  episode 1 back in the 90s. I never got a chance to play the game boy renditions as we didnâ€™t have a lot of cash.   I spent my childhood collecting cards  McDonaldâ€™s toys and backpacks/accessories. When this game came out in 2016 it reminded me how much I loved the PokÃ©mon world.   I started collecting the game boy games and sourced a couple game boys second hand and now am continuing the series on where I left off around the third generation. If you want a trip to nostalgia then this is the world for you.   Along side the new letâ€™s go Pikachu and letâ€™s go eevee games this is 90s kids dreams come true.   I also love that due to this game  phones now correctly auto-correct the word PokÃ©mon where as before it was corrected to pocket haha  Even if you donâ€™t know anything about PokÃ©mon at all like some of the older and younger friends I have... youâ€™ll find some fun in this too. I highly suggest you watch the series first  at the very least watch the first season and the first movie and maybe pick up a game boy color and play through PokÃ©mon yellow or grab a DS and play through leaf green or fire red. That will give you a better understanding of the culture that goes into this game  although not necessary. You just should. Lol

Me and my friends play this 12:00pm to 7:30pm like every day on the weekends now  itâ€™s just so fun to compete and conquer your own city/town.  The only problem is how easy that is to do.  Gym battling is heavily  HEAVILY favored towards the attacker.  The attacker can dodge attacks  bring 6 PokÃ©mon to the fight and try as many times as they like to defeat the gym  and they can bring their friends to help out.  The defender can only put one PokÃ©mon(per person  that is)  which degrades in power stupidly fast (like  100-0 overnight) and you canâ€™t even effectively repair them because you can only give so many berries at a time.  If you want to keep a PokÃ©mon in a gym at maximum strength  youâ€™d basically have to work/live in radius of it which is like 50 meters.  In addition  you can only get 50 pokecoins maximum each day from your gyms  total.  So it doesnâ€™t matter how many you are defending  you will always only get 50 per day  and one 3 use incubator  for hatching PokÃ©mon out of eggs  costs 100.  I just wish theyâ€™d make PokÃ©mon battling like it is in the Nintendo games  where its turn based. Or atleast they could dial back the CP degradation  like  tenfold

column2: I always had an it game angry birds Minecraft and when I was much younger Subway Surfers  I came across the game when I was only 5 or 6 when I was given my first devise from my parents for a Splendidly spent Christmas. It was a new  cheap  dark  Samsung Tablet. It was cheap  but very easy to use. I remember purchasing many apps  one of which a newly upgraded game called â€œSubway Surfâ€ at least thatâ€™s what I thought it was dubbed until my mother corrected me weeks after. Once my mother told me the what I thought was a complicated game actually went around as â€œSubway surfersâ€ I found this a tongue twister. â€œSubway suwfersâ€ I would incorrectly call it.  4 YEARS PASSED I had lost my iPod. My sister newly had a phone and both tablets were cracked and outdated. I was in a new house and my room was what I would have thought was a mansion when I lived in my old tiny apartment home. I picked up my sisters iPod. It had not been used for years. I pressed in my sisters passcode and saw the app subway surfers  And that lead to me playing to this day!

Iâ€™ve been playing clash of clans for about a year now and at TH8 I can say that TH7 was probably more fun to use  but new strategies allow almost new gameplay at the next level town hall  which is a fantastic concept. The night village probably could have been good but itâ€™s kind of annoying  though thatâ€™s ok if you just focus on the main base. The reason I say itâ€™s annoying is because of mismatches and difficulty at lower level builder halls to make progress if you donâ€™t play too much. If the night village were the whole game I would give 2 stars. This game includes some nice concepts such as clan castle troops and troops that can jump over walls  and spells are nice too. The graphics are really well made I think  since the game is supposed to be violent but the cartoonish graphics make it more fun and light hearted. Overall  fantastic concepts  and well executed.   Negatives: It costs 500 gems to change your username. Idc if you copy minecraft or something but like  come on Build times may be too much for some. At certain points elixir/gold gets very unbalanced because of armies With clan wars  itâ€™s almost impossible to ever get dark elixir since a hog army costs 1.5-2.5k DE at TH8. Unless you have a lot of time then there wonâ€™t be much profit if you have 1-2 clan wars a week  Otherwise  GJ

This is a game you can play both casually and competitively which is great. The community aspects that being in a clan  offer are great if you and friends are looking for an app to play together. The strategy elements bring back fond memories of this base building army training genre and have enough depth to let you experiment and enjoy yourself  yet not so much that you cant just train whatever and throw it at a base when you don't feel like going all in lol  This is one of the survivors from generation to generation of iPhone updates for a reason. Its a classic  and if you play games in your free time  enjoy strategic gameplay  or need a game to play with your friends  this app should be installed on your phone.  Another thing id like to say is that people who salt over the night village are off track.  Its more competitive in my opinion - so while i recommend trying to use it  if you don't want to play competitively then don't feel pressured to go to that island.   This island does struggle from an artificially slow progression system and honestly idk how to fix that. Only being able to (for free) collect a certain amount of loot from battles a day makes it very hard to feel like your making progress. Id love to see you get *something* out of fighting more than the three battles for daily bonuses. Flaws aside the new buildings  training mechanics  troops  and battle style (of real time vs battles) are awesome and breath strategic life into the game. It provides a platform to improve your attack strategies in. You can rush your base as long as your a god at attacking - it makes the gap between free to play players and maxed bases less impactful because a good attack wins can win you the game against better defenses  and you cant buy skilled attacking  its something you practice.

I've played the game for over 5 yrs. On the surface  Clash of Clans in an excellent mobile game that I would recommend to any casual gamer who is excited to drop their first wizard tower  hero  and/or inferno tower on the map! Where this game falls grossly short is in its customer service and pay-to-win/progress development cycle for the experienced player base. There is a rich history of dishonest press releases and customer support emails filled with friendly language offering no help to the customer (unless that customer is having trouble spending their money on Clash of Clans content). These issues easily reduce what would be a 5-star game to the 3-star rating provided. If you are competetive or a completionist  avoid this game as it is designed to extract large amounts of money from these players and the return on investment is not even close to what other titles offer for your time and finicial investment.
column5: Solid game  poor customer support  dishonest developer

Some times when you find success you're better off sticking with your core principles rather than trying to redesign/reinvent yourself and supercell unfortunately has fallen victim to their own success.  The game is nothing like it was in the beginning and unfortunately for supercell the majority of the people who also were there in the beginning long left this game for greener pastures and took their $$ with them.  I too spent quite a bit but haven't in 5 years and won't ever again.  The game now is just too gimmicky and convoluted for its own good.  The appeal for me once upon a time was the game mimicked real life where if you worked hard and saved you could build a strong defense and that was enough but now this everyone gets a trophy at the expense of the more powerful attitude has destroyed that. What's the point of saving up or buying strong walls if someone with a level one potion just jumps right over them or knocks them down?

But there is one issue  you have to grind for a long time with no way to speed up the process unless you want to pay to by resources so you donâ€™t have to wait for your collectors. Or maybe even just skip the whole process by buying gems. Besides that fact it is a amazing game if your bored or just need a pass time. Because of all these facts I give it a 4/5.

This is a very fun game  & can be quite addictive  especially if you have an active & fun clan.    But the support from Supercell is perhaps the worst I have ever seen from any large app or gaming company. Yes  they will respond quickly... but they respond with worthless dribble. They knowingly allow people to cheat or abuse holes in the system that creates unfair gameplay which is also not fun. The donâ€™t allow for the dynamic changes that can happen over years of play  such as allowing clan name changes or helping restore a clan when the only leader of the clan disappears permanently leaving all the other active players hanging in the lurch. Could they fix these things? Yes. But they chose not to & instead only focus on ways to make more money for their bottom line. Ironically  they would get a lot more of my money like they did in the early days if they would step up & be more helpful.

This is a game you can play both casually and competitively which is great. The community aspects that being in a clan  offer are great if you and friends are looking for an app to play together. The strategy elements bring back fond memories of this base building army training genre and have enough depth to let you experiment and enjoy yourself  yet not so much that you cant just train whatever and throw it at a base when you don't feel like going all in lol  This is one of the survivors from generation to generation of iPhone updates for a reason. Its a classic  and if you play games in your free time  enjoy strategic gameplay  or need a game to play with your friends  this app should be installed on your phone.  Another thing id like to say is that people who salt over the night village are off track.  Its more competitive in my opinion - so while i recommend trying to use it  if you don't want to play competitively then don't feel pressured to go to that island.   This island does struggle from an artificially slow progression system and honestly idk how to fix that. Only being able to (for free) collect a certain amount of loot from battles a day makes it very hard to feel like your making progress. Id love to see you get *something* out of fighting more than the three battles for daily bonuses. Flaws aside the new buildings  training mechanics  troops  and battle style (of real time vs battles) are awesome and breath strategic life into the game. It provides a platform to improve your attack strategies in. You can rush your base as long as your a god at attacking - it makes the gap between free to play players and maxed bases less impactful because a good attack wins can win you the game against better defenses  and you cant buy skilled attacking  its something you practice.

I've played the game for over 5 yrs. On the surface  Clash of Clans in an excellent mobile game that I would recommend to any casual gamer who is excited to drop their first wizard tower  hero  and/or inferno tower on the map! Where this game falls grossly short is in its customer service and pay-to-win/progress development cycle for the experienced player base. There is a rich history of dishonest press releases and customer support emails filled with friendly language offering no help to the customer (unless that customer is having trouble spending their money on Clash of Clans content). These issues easily reduce what would be a 5-star game to the 3-star rating provided. If you are competetive or a completionist  avoid this game as it is designed to extract large amounts of money from these players and the return on investment is not even close to what other titles offer for your time and finicial investment.
column5: Solid game  poor customer support  dishonest developer

I understand the model they have to work from to generate revenue  but it seems like there could be fewer and still show the appropriate number of ads to generate income from users. The problem is with so many options to pick from  and Solitaire being a game that's identical from one developer to another  is that the next game that has less or no ads will be the one people move to. That said  hopefully MW can tone it down some and make the overall gameplay experience less interrupted and distracting  ....it's an otherwise great execution to a fun game.
column5: Good - just expect a lot of ads

I started playing fruit ninja to pass the time ages ago and haven't stopped since.

The basic modes (classic  arcade  and zen) are really fun the the update has some issues  especially with the mini games. The mini games are WAY too expensive and you don't get many golden apples from them. And the app keeps crashing. One time I spent 300 star fruit on a mini game and it crashed and didn't give me my starfruit nor any golden apples. If I knew that would have happened I wouldn't have spent my starfruit. As with the tournament  it's nearly impossible to win because when you mix the two different colors of fruit and a bunch of bombs  you can't get any points because you'll hit the opponent's fruits which will give THEM points or you'll hit a bomb which makes you lose even more. But it you just leave the fruit to fall you'll most likely lose the game. And that makes it really frustrating because the computer can easily be programmed to swipe only the red fruit and nothing else.  The newest Halloween update is great but in the free dojo it's nearly impossible to get any candy and in the other ones you have to pay golden apples  which is an issue because of the mini games.   I know this review turned out to be really long but these problems are really frustrating. If they were fixed overall it would be a great game!
